column1: 120. Which statement is correct about IPv6 routing?
column2: IPv6 routing is enabled by default on Cisco routers.,IPv6 only supports the OSPF and EIGRP routing protocols.,IPv6 routes appear in the same routing table as IPv4 routes.,IPv6 uses the link-local address of neighbors as the next-hop address for dynamic routes.
column3: IPv6 uses the link-local address of neighbors as the next-hop address for dynamic routes.
column4: In IPv6, the link-local address of neighbors is used as the next-hop address for dynamic routes. This helps in neighbor discovery and routing in IPv6 networks.

column1: 121. Refer to the exhibit. Which type of route is 172.16.0.0/16?
column2: child route,ultimate route,default route,level 1 parent route
column4: In the context of routing, the route 172.16.0.0/16 is a level 1 parent route, also known as a summary route. It encompasses multiple child routes and represents a summarized address range.

column1: 122. Refer to the exhibit. Which type of IPv6 static route is configured in the exhibit?
column2: directly attached static route,recursive static route,fully specified static route,floating static route
column4: The exhibit shows a directly attached IPv6 static route. It specifies the destination network and the outgoing interface directly connected to that network.

column1: 123. Which summary IPv6 static route statement can be configured to summarize only the routes to networks 2001:db8:cafe::/58 through 2001:db8:cafe:c0::/58?
column2: ipv6 route 2001:db8:cafe::/62 S0/0/0,ipv6 route 2001:db8:cafe::/54 S0/0/0,ipv6 route 2001:db8:cafe::/56 S0/0/0,ipv6 route 2001:db8:cafe::/60 S0/0/0
column4: To summarize the routes from 2001:db8:cafe::/58 through 2001:db8:cafe:c0::/58, you can use the command "ipv6 route 2001:db8:cafe::/56 S0/0/0". This covers the specified range with a /56 prefix length.

column1: 124. Refer to the exhibit. If RIPng is enabled, how many hops away does R1 consider the 2001:0DB8:ACAD:1::/64 network to be?
column4: In the exhibit, you can see that R1 is directly connected to the network 2001:0DB8:ACAD:1::/64, and it has two outgoing interfaces to reach that network. Therefore, R1 considers it to be 2 hops away.

column1: 125. Which statement is true about the difference between OSPFv2 and OSPFv3?
column2: OSPFv3 routers use a different metric than OSPFv2 routers use.,OSPFv3 routers use a 128 bit router ID instead of a 32 bit ID.,OSPFv3 routers do not need to elect a DR on multiaccess segments.,OSPFv3 routers do not need to have matching subnets to form neighbor adjacencies.
column3: OSPFv3 routers do not need to elect a DR on multiaccess segments.
column4: In OSPFv3, the concept of a Designated Router (DR) is not used on multiaccess segments like it is in OSPFv2. OSPFv3 routers on a multiaccess segment communicate directly with each other, eliminating the need for a DR election.

column1: 126. What happens immediately after two OSPF routers have exchanged hello packets and have formed a neighbor adjacency?
column2: They exchange DBD packets in order to advertise parameters such as hello and dead intervals.,They negotiate the election process if they are on a multiaccess network.,They request more information about their databases.,They exchange abbreviated lists of their LSDBs.
column3: They exchange DBD packets in order to advertise parameters such as hello and dead intervals.
column4: After OSPF routers have exchanged hello packets and formed a neighbor adjacency, they exchange Database Description (DBD) packets to advertise information about their link-state database, including hello and dead interval parameters.

column1: 127. What does the cost of an OSPF link indicate?
column2: A higher cost for an OSPF link indicates a faster path to the destination.,Link cost indicates a proportion of the accumulated value of the route to the destination.,Cost equals bandwidth.,A lower cost indicates a better path to the destination than a higher cost does.
column3: A lower cost indicates a better path to the destination than a higher cost does.
column4: In OSPF, the cost of a link is used to indicate the preference for a path. A lower cost indicates a more preferred path, meaning it is a better path to the destination than a higher-cost path.

column1: 128. Which three pieces of information does a link-state routing protocol use initially as link-state information for locally connected links? (Choose three.)
column2: the link router interface IP address and subnet mask,the type of network link,the link next-hop IP address,the link bandwidth,the cost of that link
column3: the type of network link,the link bandwidth,the cost of that link
column4: Link-state routing protocols initially use three pieces of information for locally connected links: the type of network link, the link bandwidth, and the cost of that link.

column1: 129. Which three requirements are necessary for two OSPFv2 routers to form an adjacency? (Choose three.)
column2: The OSPF hello or dead timers on each router must match.,The link interface subnet masks must match.,The OSPFv2 process ID must be the same on each router.,The two routers must include the inter-router link network in an OSPFv2 network command.,The OSPFv2 process is enabled on the interface by entering the ospf process area-id command.,The link interface on each router must be configured with a link-local address.
column3: The OSPF hello or dead timers on each router must match.,The link interface subnet masks must match.,The OSPFv2 process is enabled on the interface by entering the ospf process area-id command.
column4: For two OSPFv2 routers to form an adjacency, the following requirements must be met: 1. The OSPF hello or dead timers on each router must match. 2. The link interface subnet masks must match. 3. The OSPFv2 process is enabled on the interface by entering the ospf process area-id command.

column1: 130. A router needs to be configured to route within OSPF area 0. Which two commands are required to accomplish this? (Choose two.)
column2: RouterA(config)# router ospf 0,RouterA(config)# router ospf 1,RouterA(config-router)# network 192.168.2.0 0.0.0.255 0,RouterA(config-router)# network 192.168.2.0 0.0.0.255 area 0,RouterA(config-router)# network 192.168.2.0 255.255.255.0 0
column4: To configure a router to participate in OSPF area 0, you need the following two commands: 1. RouterA(config)# router ospf 0: This command enters OSPF configuration mode. 2. RouterA(config-router)# network 192.168.2.0 0.0.0.255 area 0: This command specifies the network and assigns it to OSPF area 0.

column1: 131. What are two features of a link-state routing protocol? (Choose two.)
column2: Routers send periodic updates only to neighboring routers.,Routers send triggered updates in response to a change.,Routers create a topology of the network by using information from other routers.,The database information for each router is obtained from the same source.,Paths are chosen based on the lowest number of hops to the designated router.
column3: Routers send triggered updates in response to a change.,Routers create a topology of the network by using information from other routers.
column4: Two features of a link-state routing protocol are: 1. Routers send triggered updates in response to a change in the network topology. 2. Routers create a topology of the network by using information from other routers, resulting in a comprehensive view of the network.

column1: 132. Why would an administrator use a network security auditing tool to flood the switch MAC address table with fictitious MAC addresses?
column2: to determine which ports are not correctly configured to prevent MAC address flooding,to determine when the CAM table size needs to be increased in order to prevent overflows,to determine if the switch is forwarding the broadcast traffic correctly,to determine which ports are functioning
column3: to determine which ports are not correctly configured to prevent MAC address flooding
column4: An administrator may use a network security auditing tool to flood the switch MAC address table with fictitious MAC addresses to identify ports that are not correctly configured, potentially to prevent MAC address flooding attacks.

column1: 133. Which problem is evident if the show ip interface command shows that the interface is down and the line protocol is down?
column2: An encapsulation mismatch has occurred.,A cable has not been attached to the port.,The no shutdown command has not been issued on the interface.,There is an IP address conflict with the configured address on the interface.
column3: A cable has not been attached to the port.
column4: When the show ip interface command displays that the interface is down and the line protocol is down, it typically indicates that no cable is physically connected to the port, resulting in a lack of connectivity.

column1: 134. While analyzing log files, a network administrator notices reoccurring native VLAN mismatches. What is the effect of these reoccurring errors?
column2: All traffic on the error-occurring trunk port is being misdirected or dropped.,The control and management traffic on the error-occurring trunk port is being misdirected or dropped.,All traffic on the error-occurring trunk port is being switched correctly regardless of the error.,Unexpected traffic on the error-occurring trunk port is being received.?
column3: The control and management traffic on the error-occurring trunk port is being misdirected or dropped.
column4: Reoccurring native VLAN mismatches on a trunk port can result in the control and management traffic on the trunk being misdirected or dropped, potentially causing network issues.

column1: 135. Which three pairs of trunking modes will establish a functional trunk link between two Cisco switches? (Choose three.)
column2: dynamic desirable – dynamic desirable,dynamic auto – dynamic auto,dynamic desirable – dynamic auto,dynamic desirable – trunk,access – trunk,access – dynamic auto
column3: dynamic desirable – dynamic desirable,dynamic auto – dynamic auto,dynamic desirable – trunk
column4: To establish a functional trunk link between two Cisco switches, you can use the following trunking mode pairs: dynamic desirable – dynamic desirable, dynamic auto – dynamic auto, dynamic desirable – trunk.

column1: 136. What are two ways of turning off DTP on a trunk link between switches? (Choose two.)
column2: Change the native VLAN on both ports.,Configure attached switch ports with the dynamic desirable command option.,Configure attached switch ports with the nonegotiate command option.,Configure one port with the dynamic auto command option and the opposite attached switch port with the dynamic desirable command option.,Place the two attached switch ports in access mode.
column3: Configure attached switch ports with the nonegotiate command option.,Place the two attached switch ports in access mode.
column4: To turn off DTP on a trunk link between switches, you can: 1. Configure attached switch ports with the nonegotiate command option. 2. Place the two attached switch ports in access mode.

column1: 137. On a switch that is configured with multiple VLANs, which command will remove only VLAN 100 from the switch?
column2: Switch# delete flash:vlan.dat,Switch(config-if)# no switchport access vlan 100,Switch(config-if)# no switchport trunk allowed vlan 100,Switch(config)# no vlan 100
column4: To remove only VLAN 100 from a switch configured with multiple VLANs, you can use the command "Switch(config)# no vlan 100".

column1: 138. What is the purpose of setting the native VLAN separate from data VLANs?
column2: The native VLAN is for carrying VLAN management traffic only.,The security of management frames that are carried in the native VLAN can be enhanced.,A separate VLAN should be used to carry uncommon untagged frames to avoid bandwidth contention on data VLANs.,The native VLAN is for routers and switches to exchange their management information, so it should be different from data VLANs.
column3: A separate VLAN should be used to carry uncommon untagged frames to avoid bandwidth contention on data VLANs.
column4: Setting the native VLAN separate from data VLANs is done to ensure that uncommon untagged frames (such as those from misconfigured devices) do not interfere with the normal operation of data VLANs, reducing the risk of bandwidth contention.

column1: 139. A network contains multiple VLANs spanning multiple switches. What happens when a device in VLAN 20 sends a broadcast Ethernet frame?
column2: All devices in all VLANs see the frame.,Devices in VLAN 20 and the management VLAN see the frame.,Only devices in VLAN 20 see the frame.,Only devices that are connected to the local switch see the frame.
column3: Only devices in VLAN 20 see the frame.
column4: When a device in VLAN 20 sends a broadcast Ethernet frame, only devices within VLAN 20 will see the frame. VLANs are isolated broadcast domains, and broadcasts do not traverse between VLANs unless routed.

column1: 140. Refer to the exhibit. The partial configuration that is shown was used to configure router on a stick for VLANS 10, 30, and 50. However, testing shows that there are some connectivity problems between the VLANs. Which configuration error is causing this problem?
column2: A configuration for the native VLAN is missing.,There is no IP address configured for the FastEthernet 0/0 interface.,The wrong VLAN has been configured on subinterface Fa0/0.50.?,The VLAN IP addresses should belong to the same subnet.?

column1: 141. What is the purpose of an access list that is created as part of configuring IP address translation?
column2: The access list defines the valid public addresses for the NAT or PAT pool.,The access list defines the private IP addresses that are to be translated.,The access list prevents external devices from being a part of the address translation.,The access list permits or denies specific addresses from entering the device doing the translation.
column3: The access list defines the private IP addresses that are to be translated.
column4: An access list created as part of configuring IP address translation defines the private IP addresses that are allowed to be translated into public addresses. It controls which internal addresses are subject to NAT or PAT.

column1: 143. Beginning with the Cisco IOS Software Release 15.0, which license is a prerequisite for installing additional technology pack licenses?
column2: UC,IPBase,SEC,DATA
column4: Beginning with Cisco IOS Software Release 15.0, the IPBase license is a prerequisite for installing additional technology pack licenses.

column1: 144. Refer to the exhibit. How many broadcast and collision domains exist in the topology?

column1: 145. What is a function of the distribution layer?
column2: fault isolation,network access to the user,high-speed backbone connectivity,interconnection of large-scale networks in wiring closets
column4: One of the functions of the distribution layer is to provide high-speed backbone connectivity within the network.

column1: 146. Fill in the blank. In IPv6, all routes are level __1__ ultimate routes.

column1: 149. Fill in the blank. The default administrative distance for a static route is __1__.

column1: 150. When a Cisco switch receives untagged frames on a 802.1Q trunk port, which VLAN ID is the traffic switched to by default?
column2: data VLAN ID,native VLAN ID,unused VLAN ID,management VLAN ID
column4: When a Cisco switch receives untagged frames on an 802.1Q trunk port, the traffic is switched to the native VLAN ID by default.

column1: 152. How is the router ID for an OSPFv3 router determined?
column2: the highest IPv6 address on an active interface,the highest EUI-64 ID on an active interface,the highest IPv4 address on an active interface,the lowest MAC address on an active interface

column1: 153. Which two statements are characteristics of routed ports on a multilayer switch? (Choose two.)
column2: In a switched network, they are mostly configured between switches at the core and distribution layers.,They support subinterfaces, like interfaces on the Cisco IOS routers.,The interface vlan command has to be entered to create a VLAN on routed ports.,They are used for point-to-multipoint links.,They are not associated with a particular VLAN.
column3: In a switched network, they are mostly configured between switches at the core and distribution layers.,They are not associated with a particular VLAN.
column4: Routed ports on a multilayer switch are often configured between switches at the core and distribution layers, and they are not associated with a particular VLAN.

column1: 155. A small-sized company has 20 workstations and 2 servers. The company has been assigned a group of IPv4 addresses 209.165.200.224/29 from its ISP. What technology should the company implement in order to allow the workstations to access the services over the Internet?
column2: static NAT,dynamic NAT,port address translation,DHCP
column4: To allow the workstations to access services over the Internet with a small number of public IPv4 addresses, the company should implement static NAT (Network Address Translation).

column1: 156. What best describes the operation of distance vector routing protocols?
column2: They use hop count as their only metric.,They send their routing tables to directly connected neighbors.,They flood the entire network with routing updates.,They only send out updates when a new network is added.
column3: They use hop count as their only metric.
column4: Distance vector routing protocols use hop count as their primary metric for route selection.

column1: 157. Which three advantages are provided by static routing? (Choose three.)
column2: The path a static route uses to send data is known.,No intervention is required to maintain changing route information.,Static routing does not advertise over the network, thus providing better security.,Static routing typically uses less network bandwidth and fewer CPU operations than dynamic routing does.,Configuration of static routes is error-free.,Static routes scale well as the network grows.
column3: The path a static route uses to send data is known.,No intervention is required to maintain changing route information.,Static routing does not advertise over the network, thus providing better security.
column4: Static routing offers the advantages of knowing the route path, not requiring intervention for changing route information, and providing better security by not advertising routes. Additionally, static routing is typically more efficient in terms of network bandwidth and CPU usage than dynamic routing, and it's error-free when properly configured.

column1: 158. When configuring a switch to use SSH for virtual terminal connections, what is the purpose of the crypto key generate rsa command?

column4: The 'crypto key generate rsa' command is used to generate a public and private key pair for use in SSH (Secure Shell) connections.

column1: 159. Open the PT Activity. Perform the tasks in the activity instructions and then answer the question. What is the problem preventing PC0 and PC1 from communicating with PC2 and PC3?

column1: 160. Which two commands can be used to verify the content and placement of access control lists? (Choose two.)

column1: 161. Refer to the exhibit. What summary static address would be configured on R1 to advertise to R3?
column4: To summarize the addresses of the networks 192.168.0.0/24, 192.168.1.0/24, and 192.168.2.0/24, a summary static address of 192.168.0.0/22 should be configured on R1 to advertise to R3.

column1: 162. Which value represents the “trustworthiness” of a route and is used to determine which route to install into the routing table when there are multiple routes toward the same destination?
column2: routing protocol,outgoing interface,metric,administrative distance
column4: The administrative distance represents the trustworthiness of a route and is used to determine which route to install into the routing table when there are multiple routes toward the same destination. A lower administrative distance indicates a more trusted route.

column1: 163. Which type of router memory temporarily stores the running configuration file and ARP table?
column2: flash,NVRAM,RAM,ROM
column4: RAM (Random Access Memory) is the type of router memory that temporarily stores the running configuration file and ARP table during device operation.

column1: 164. Refer to the exhibit. If the switch reboots and all routers have to re-establish OSPF adjacencies, which routers will become the new DR and BDR?
column2: Router R3 will become the DR and router R1 will become the BDR.,Router R1 will become the DR and router R2 will become the BDR.,Router R4 will become the DR and router R3 will become the BDR.,Router R1 will become the DR and router R2 will become the BDR.
column3: Router R1 will become the DR and router R2 will become the BDR.
column4: When OSPF routers re-establish adjacencies, the router with the highest priority becomes the DR (Designated Router), and the router with the second-highest priority becomes the BDR (Backup Designated Router). In this case, router R1 has the highest priority, so it becomes the DR, and router R2 becomes the BDR.

column1: 165. Refer to the exhibit. The Branch Router has an OSPF neighbor relationship with the HQ router over the 198.51.0.4/30 network. The 198.51.0.8/30 network link should serve as a backup when the OSPF link goes down. The floating static route command ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 S0/1/1 100 was issued on Branch and now traffic is using the backup link even when the OSPF link is up and functioning. column4: To make sure traffic only uses the OSPF link when it is up, you should change the administrative distance of the static route to 1, which is lower than OSPF's administrative distance.

column1: 166. Refer to the exhibit. An attacker on PC X sends a frame with two 802.1Q tags on it, one for VLAN 40 and another for VLAN 12. What will happen to this frame?
column2: SW-A will drop the frame because it is invalid.,SW-A will leave both tags on the frame and send it to SW-B, which will forward it to hosts on VLAN 40.,SW-A will remove both tags and forward the rest of the frame across the trunk link, where SW-B will forward the frame to hosts on VLAN 40.,SW-A will remove the outer tag and send the rest of the frame across the trunk link, where SW-B will forward the frame to hosts on VLAN 12.
column3: SW-A will remove the outer tag and send the rest of the frame across the trunk link, where SW-B will forward the frame to hosts on VLAN 12.
column4: The outer VLAN tag (VLAN 12) will be removed by SW-A, and the frame will be forwarded across the trunk link to SW-B, where it will be treated as belonging to VLAN 12.

column1: 168. An OSPF router has three directly connected networks; 172.16.0.0/16, 172.16.1.0/16, and 172.16.2.0/16. Which OSPF network command would advertise only the 172.16.1.0 network to neighbors?

column1: 170. Refer to the exhibit. A small business uses VLANs 8, 20, 25, and 30 on two switches that have a trunk link between them. What native VLAN should be used on the trunk if Cisco best practices are being implemented?
column4: Cisco best practices recommend using VLAN 1 as the native VLAN on trunk links. In this scenario, VLAN 1 should be used as the native VLAN.

column1: 178. What is the minimum configuration for a router interface that is participating in IPv6 routing?

column4: The minimum configuration for a router interface that is participating in IPv6 routing is to have a link-local IPv6 address configured on the interface. This allows the router to participate in local link communications.

column1: 179. Which two statements are true about half-duplex and full-duplex communications? (Choose two.)
column2: Full duplex offers 100 percent potential use of the bandwidth,Half duplex has only one channel,All modern NICs support both half-duplex and full-duplex communication,Full duplex allows both ends to transmit and receive simultaneously,Full duplex increases the effective bandwidth.
column3: Full duplex offers 100 percent potential use of the bandwidth,Full duplex allows both ends to transmit and receive simultaneously
column4: Full duplex offers 100 percent potential use of the bandwidth because it allows both ends to transmit and receive simultaneously, effectively utilizing the entire bandwidth. Half duplex has only one channel and is unidirectional, allowing communication in one direction at a time. All modern NICs support both half-duplex and full-duplex communication, but full duplex is preferred for increased efficiency and effective bandwidth utilization.

column1: 180. Fill in the blank. The acronym describes the type of traffic that has strict QoS requirements and utilizes a one-way overall delay less than 150 ms across the network.

column1: 183. What is the effect of issuing the passive-interface default command on a router that is configured for OSPF?
